alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Fergus County below 4500ft; Hill County; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Northern Blaine County; Northern High Plains; Snowy and Judith Mountains; Southern High Plains; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 22 at 1:37AM MST until January 22 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...A combination of freezing drizzle, light snow, and frost deposition from freezing fog is expected. Ice accumulations of a glaze, with snow accumulations of up to half of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central Montana. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST this morning. * IMPACTS...Exposed surfaces including sidewalks, roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. The hazardous conditions may impact the Monday morning peak travel time. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Freezing fog may reduce visibility below one mile at times.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be18 obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
